Key Match Events: Malik Beasley's well timed steal helped the Pistons edge forward
Anfernee Simons exploded for 36 factors and 9 assists
Cade Cunningham's 32 factors and 9 assists were essential in the victory
Post-Match Reflections: This was a basic instance of clutch protection. The Pistons might not have been the favorites, but they showed heart when it mattered most
Maxey did everything he could to keep Philly in the hunt, but Phoenix showed they could adapt and close out games in tough conditions
Haliburton is showing why he’s one of the best young point guards in the league. The Pacers look well-drilled, and Brooklyn's struggles continue with defensive lapses
Orlando continues to shock with consistency, while New York can't appear to find a rhythm this season. The Knicks' depth points have gotten more obvious
Giannis showed why he’s one of the most full players in the league. Milwaukee needed this win, and they got it in style. Toronto, on the other hand, is caught in a rut with little momentum
LaVine was a star, but let’s give credit to the Spurs for hanging tough against a gifted Bulls squad. Wembanyama's ceiling remains so high, even when the Spurs couldn't get the W today
Jackson was completely excellent, and Memphis showed why they're a dangerous playoff contender. Dallas has the talent, but they lacked consistency when it mattered most
Edwards was clutch, but credit to the Timberwolves for digging deep in a good game. The Clippers are having an inconsistent season, and this game was a reminder of their struggles
De’Aaron Fox delivered late-game heroics, and Domantas Sabonis posted a monster stat line with 21 points, 18 rebounds, and 11 assists
Miscellaneous Highlights: Zach LaVine's 35 points and 10 rebounds powered the Bulls
Victor Wembanyama, with 23 points and 14 rebounds, did his best to keep San Antonio in the game
Jaren Jackson Jr. was the standout performer, scoring 35 points and grabbing 13 rebounds
Domantas Sabonis had a double-double with 21 points, 18 rebounds, and 11 assists
Ivica Zubac contributed a double-double for the Clippers
The game went into double overtime
De’Aaron Fox and Domantas Sabonis had impressive performances
